result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Marquard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit to be determined.  Attorney Rumpf to provide the court with documentation regarding sentence credit.  If no documentation provided, 0 days credit.
AMENDED 3/8/2017:  COURT GRANTS 23 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF REVOKED.
May be transferred to Oneida County.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
No Use of Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time, STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Rumpf advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Letter dated 3/2/17 from ADA Dewire, approving defense request for jail credit.  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 3/8/17 - Amend J of C to include the 23 days credit if revoked**
In Custody report dated 2/23/17, in support of defense counsel's 2/28/17 request that Judgment of Conviction be amended to reflect 23 days of jail credit.

Letter dated 2/28/17 rec'd from defense counsel, requesting Judgment of Conviction be amended to reflect 23 days of jail credit.  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 3/1/17 - has this been reviewed or approved by the State?**
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott A Marquard in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Loshaw for Amber K. Rumpf.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count #1 of the Amended Information. Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Loshaw makes statements. Defendant makes statements. Case #15CF1604 is dismissed and read in to this case.

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - TBD days).  STAYED. Atty. Rumpf to provide the court with documentation regarding sentence credit. If no documentation provided, 0 days credit.

Term of Probation: 1 Year (Can be transferred to Oneida County)

Conditions of Probation:

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

-40 hours community service.
	
-AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

-No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

-Maintain/Obtain full time employment;

Condition Time: 10 days Jail. STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

COSTS:  $243.00    to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
